metadata.title: As a student, I want to interact with a simple, colorful, and easy-to-navigate interface, so that I can focus on learning without getting distracted

story.iWant: interact with a simple, colorful, and easy-to-navigate interface
story.soThat: I can focus on learning without getting distracted.
story.tasks: - [ ] **Frontend Development (UI Components):** - [ ] Implement and style core UI components (`Button`, `Input`, `Select`, `Card`) using Shadcn UI and Tailwind CSS. - [ ] Develop custom `ChatBubbleComponent`, `ChatHistory`, `WelcomeScreen`, `TypingIndicator` based on UX spec. - [ ] Ensure consistent application of the "Trustworthy Learner" color palette across all UI elements. - [ ] **Layout and Responsiveness:** - [ ] Implement responsive layouts for `ChatInterfaceModule`, `WelcomeScreenModule`, and `OptionsModalModule`. - [ ] Verify full functionality and correct adaptation on desktop, laptop, and tablet screen sizes according to breakpoints. - [ ] **Interactive Elements and Accessibility:** - [ ] Ensure all interactive elements (`Button`, `Input`, `Select`) are clearly labeled and meet the minimum touch target size (44x44 CSS pixels). - [ ] Implement keyboard navigation and focus indicators for all interactive elements. - [ ] Verify screen reader support for key UI components. - [ ] Conduct color contrast checks to ensure WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance. - [ ] **Testing:** - [ ] Unit tests for individual UI components (e.g., `ChatBubbleComponent`, `WelcomeScreen`). - [ ] E2E tests for main user journeys on different screen sizes to validate responsiveness. - [ ] Manual UI/UX testing for visual consistency, interactivity, and accessibility.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: - **1.1.** The application's UI consistently applies the "Trustworthy Learner" color palette defined in the UX Design Specification's chosen theme ("Trustworthy Learner") and design direction ("Source-Integrated Chat with Clean Header Options"). - **1.2.** All interactive elements (buttons, input fields, selectors) are clearly labeled and have a minimum touch target size of 44x44 CSS pixels. - **1.3.** The main chat screen displays no more than 4 primary interactive actions (e.g., chat input, send, options). - **1.4.** The application layout (chat interface, welcome screen, options modal) adapts correctly and remains fully functional on desktop, laptop, and tablet screen sizes, adhering to defined breakpoints.

doc.title: Product Roadmap: Sentiabot
doc.section: Epic 3: Enhanced User Experience and Features
doc.snippet: Goal: Improve the user interface and add key features that make the tool more useful and engaging for students. Story 3.1: As a student, I want to interact with a simple, colorful, and easy-to-navigate interface, so that I can focus on learning without getting distracted.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Epic 3
doc.snippet: This technical specification outlines the implementation details for Epic 3: "Enhanced User Experience and Features"... The focus is on creating a trustworthy, engaging, and minimalist web application that fosters feelings of efficiency, productivity, and curiosity.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Epic 3
doc.section: For Story 3.1: Simple, Colorful, Easy-to-Navigate Interface
doc.snippet: Defines the Acceptance Criteria for Story 3.1, focusing on UI consistency, interactive elements, layout, and responsiveness across devices.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Sentiabot is an AI-powered educational tool... The design will heavily draw inspiration from existing, successful AI chat applications... Key design principles will include a conversation-focused UI, effortless input mechanisms, clear presentation of information sources to build trust, and consistent, predictable interactions.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Decision: Shadcn UI. Rationale: Unparalleled flexibility... strong accessibility... facilitates precise customization and integration within the existing frontend framework.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Principles: Speed & Responsiveness, Clarity & Guidance, Trust & Reliability, Engagement & Simplicity. These guide every UX decision for Sentiabot.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Chosen Theme: Trustworthy Learner... Primary Color: #2563eb (Blue - Trust, Intelligence)... Rationale: calming and authoritative blues and greens... orange accent subtly piques curiosity and clearly highlights interactive elements.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: An 8px base unit grid system... well-defined spacing scale... standard 12-column responsive grid system... Main content areas will have a maximum width...

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Decision: Combined Direction... "Source-Integrated Chat with Clean Header Options"... Personality: Trustworthy, Educational, and User-Controlled... Key Characteristics: Single column, chat-focused layout, Primary Action Prominence: High...

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Leveraging the Shadcn UI ecosystem... Provides unstyled, accessible, and highly composable primitives. Lists standard components (Button, Input, Card, Select, Dialog, etc.) and custom components (ChatBubble, ChatHistory, WelcomeScreen, TypingIndicator).

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Defines consistent rules for Button Hierarchy, Feedback Patterns (Loading, Success, Error), Form Patterns, Modal Patterns, Empty State Pattern, Confirmation Patterns across the application.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: Ensures the user experience adapts seamlessly and intuitively to different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile). Defines Layout Adaptation, Touch Optimization, Breakpoint Strategy.

doc.title: ibe160 UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: WCAG Compliance Target: WCAG 2.1 Level AA. Key Requirements: Keyboard Navigation, Focus Indicators, Screen Reader Support, Color Contrast, Scalable Text, Touch Target Size. Testing Strategy: Automated and Manual Testing.

doc.title: UX Design Spec Validation Report
doc.snippet: Overall: 122/154 passed (79.22%) with 3 Critical Issues. Report validates the collaborative UX design facilitation, highlighting areas for improvement to ensure a complete and robust specification.

Standard Shadcn UI component, used for interactive actions like "Start Chatting", "Send", "Options".
Standard Shadcn UI component, used for the main chat text entry.
Custom component to visually communicate bot processing; relevant for UI responsiveness.
Custom component, part of ChatBubble, to display source links. Directly supports AC 1.1 (UI consistency) and AC 1.2 (interactive elements).
Custom component to display individual messages; foundational for story's UI, integrating other components like SourcedLink.

constraint.description: Build UIs from encapsulated, reusable components, adhering to single responsibility principle.
Structure UI components from smallest (atoms) to largest (pages/templates).
Enforce strict typing throughout the codebase.
Adhere to Naming Conventions (PascalCase for React Components, kebab-case for files/folders) and Code Organization (Feature-based, Shared UI, Pages/Layouts).
Maintain responsiveness across desktop, laptop, and tablet devices.
WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance, including keyboard navigation, focus indicators, screen reader support, color contrast, scalable text, and touch target size.

standards.standard: Testing will be conducted across multiple levels (unit, integration, E2E) with a strong emphasis on manual UI/UX validation. Frontend tests will use Vitest and React Testing Library for unit/integration, and Playwright/Cypress for E2E. Accessibility will be checked using Lighthouse, axe DevTools, and manual screen reader testing. Each Acceptance Criterion will have at least one corresponding test case.

locations.location: Test files are co-located with the source code they test, using `*.test.ts` or `*.spec.ts` naming convention.

idea.description: Visual inspection for consistent color usage across all UI components and pages.
Manual testing for labels, keyboard navigation (Tab/Shift+Tab), and touch target sizes of buttons, input fields, and selectors.
Visual inspection of the main chat screen to verify no more than 4 primary interactive actions are visible.
E2E testing or manual browser resizing to verify layout and functionality adapt correctly on desktop, laptop, and tablet screen sizes.
Run Lighthouse and axe DevTools to identify accessibility issues. Conduct manual screen reader tests for key user flows.
